verbose_text: In the total study population, the increased CVD risk associated with dysglycemia persisted after adjusting for multiple conventional risk factors such as systolic blood pressure, antihypertensive medications, LDL and HDL cholesterol levels, smoking status, BMI, and family history of CVD (grade 1 IFG, 1.02 [0.99-1.05]; grade 2 IFG, 1.05 [1.01-1.10]; and type 2 diabetes, 1.49 [1.45-1.54]).
